title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A classic Italian pasta dish featuring spaghetti tossed in a creamy sauce made with eggs, Parmesan cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside, reserving some pasta water.
In a skillet, cook the pancetta or bacon until crispy. Remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the pancetta or bacon. Toss to combine.

Remove the skillet from heat and quickly pour the egg mixture over the hot spaghetti, tossing continuously to coat the pasta evenly. If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of reserved pasta water to loosen it.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional grated Parmesan cheese and black pepper.

title: Beef Stir-Fry with Vegetables
description: A flavorful stir-fry featuring tender slices of beef, assorted vegetables, and a savory sauce, served over steamed rice.
instructions: Slice the beef thinly against the grain. In a bowl, combine the beef slices with 1 tablespoon of soy sauce and cornstarch. Set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.
In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Add the marinated beef slices and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add more oil if needed. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook until fragrant.
Add sliced bell peppers, broccoli florets, and julienned carrot to the skillet. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp.

In a small bowl, mix together the remaining soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and return the cooked beef to the skillet. Toss everything together until well coated.
Cook for another minute or until heated through.
Serve the beef stir-fry over cooked rice.
